resources.string: Darwin is credited with discovering the theory of natural selection. He also uncovered more facts about evolution and how old our planet Earth really is.
Curie was the first woman to receive the Nobel Prize for her work with radioactivity and radium. She pioneered the discovery and use of X-rays.

One of the most famous scientists, Einstein is credited with creating the theory of relativity and for developing the worldâ€™s most famous mathematical equation. He also developed a law called the photoelectric effect, for which he received a Nobel Prize in physics.
Fleming was a pharmacologist who helped create penicillin, a revolutionary breakthrough in the world of medicine. His discoveries were the catalyst for modern antibiotics.
Known as the founder of modern physics and one of the most famous scientists ever, Galileo discovered many theories and laws in his lifetime, including the law of inertia.
